replies.bodyText: I checked the code and it kinda doesn't make sense to add it into this loop. Basically if the metric is set properly is tested by new asserts which I added after this loop.

timeline.bodyText: if there is no resource of a specific kind, the corresponding state_resource_state metric should not exist. Do you see it existing but with 0 value?
timeline.author: ppatierno

replies.bodyText: In case it's not exists, the check return 0, but it return 0 in case the resource is nto ready. I can try to rewrite it a little bit and check that metric is not expsoed in case the resource is nto created.
replies.author: Frawless

replies.bodyText: Yeah exactly, they are two different things: metric doesn't exist vs metric 0 (resource not ready). I would test them differently.
